subject: Re: [junit] Ordered execution of test cases
msgSnippet: Hello, ... This is a possible solution I found too. IMHO this is not very useful in my case, because I still like to know which tests succeeded and which
messageBody:
Hello,


>> When I start the TestRunner provided by Ant first the method "runTest"
>> is executed (which is OK). But then the other methods are executed in an
>> arbritrary order (I suppose). How can I change this behaviour?

> Simply rename your test methods so they don't start with *test* word, this
> will prevent them to be executed by TestRunner.

This is a possible solution I found too. IMHO this is not very useful in
my case, because I still like to know which tests succeeded and which didn't.
Unfortunately this does only work if you have written "testXXX" methods because
JUnit invokes these methods independantly.

> Dependent actions should be written within one test case. There was
> a discussion on this mailing list few weeks ago (look for the thread [junit]
> Order of Tests).
I found these discussions and do not agree. In my application area the
result is that I have several mini test case which depend heavily on
each other. The glue between them would be a number of test cases which
must themselves be used in larger test suites (can I nest test suites,
btw?).

Regards
Boris Boehlen
